articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Accuses Japan of Railroading Security Bills through Meeting of House of Councillors
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Accuses Japan of Railroading Security Bills through Meeting of House of Councillors
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry Saturday issued a statement accusing Japan of railroading the security bills based on the new "Japan-U.S. Defense Cooperation Guidelines" through the meeting of the House of Councillors on Friday.
					 The "security law" which comprises the "law on readjusting the law on peace and security" and "law on support to international peace" related to the dispatch of "the Self-Defense Forces" overseas, a comprehensive revision of ten laws, is the evil law worked out to pave the way for invading other countries from A to Z.
					
					 The enactment of the "security law" helps Japan stage military operations in every part of the world under the pretext of protecting peace and security and assisting the U.S. forces and dispatch the SDF overseas any time, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Japan's militarist moves are posing a grave threat to peace and stability in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The present situation clearly proves how just the DPRK was when it has bolstered up its capability for self-defence as strong as an iron wall under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The DPRK will further increase the war deterrence to cope with the dangerous moves for aggression against it.
					
					 Japan has enacted the war law in the long-run, obsessed with an anachronistic ambition for reinvasion. This will compel Tokyo to suffer another horrible war disaster and it will have to regret it forever.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Indonesia Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Indonesia Appointed
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- An Kwang Il was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Indonesia, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Congratulations to Gabonese FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Gabonese FM
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Emmanuel Issoze Ngondet upon his reappointment as Gabonese minister of State and minister of Foreign Affairs, Francophone and Regional Integration.
					 He assured his Gabonese counterpart in the message that he would continue to join him in the efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in the interests of the two peoples and wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Congratulations to Prime Minster of Trinidad and Tobago
articles.content:
Congratulations to Prime Minster of Trinidad and Tobago
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Sept. 14 sent a congratulatory message to Keith Rowley upon his appointment as prime minister of Trinidad and Tobago.
					 The message wished him success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Delegations of Different Countries, Regions Here
articles.content:
Delegations of Different Countries, Regions Here
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Delegations of Germany, Malaysia, Singapore, China, Italy and Vietnam arrived here on Saturday to take part in the 11th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair.
					 Also arriving here earlier were delegations of Romania and Taipei of China.

articles.title: EAFF Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
EAFF Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF) led by Chairman Zhang Jian visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Saturday.
					 Being briefed on the sacred place of the sun, members of the delegation looked round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae with much care.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the May Day Stadium and Pyongyang International Football School.
					
					 On the same day it hosted a reception on behalf of the EAFF.

articles.title: Traditional Musical Instruments of Korea Improved
articles.content:
Traditional Musical Instruments of Korea Improved
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition recently took place at the Pyongyang International House of Culture.
					 On display there were a lot of traditional instruments, which have been improved in line with modern aesthetic taste.
					
					 Those improved traditional instruments are now winning popularity among musicians and fans as they are better than the existing ones in terms of cultural refinement and tone quality.
					
					 According to Director Kim Yong Chol, the National Musical Instrument Institute developed Taehaegum (a big Korean four-string fiddle) into a type of bottle gourd to reinforce its tones, compass and volume.
					
					 The improved traditional instruments also include Kayagum (Korean harp), Oungum, Okryugum and Janggu.
					
					 The exhibition showed how the traditional instruments have been developed in the country, Ri Chang Gun, manager of the Pyongyang Traditional Musical Instrument Factory, told KCNA. And he expressed his will to strive for further improvement of traditional instruments.

articles.title: Juvenile Records Renewed in Swimming Events
articles.content:
Juvenile Records Renewed in Swimming Events
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Eight domestic juvenile records were shattered in the swimming events of the 52nd National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools held in Pyongyang some days ago.
					 Those events include men's 50-meter and 100-meter freestyle and 50-meter butterfly and women's 200-meter butterfly, 400-meter medley and 800-meter freestyle.
					
					 Among successful swimmers are those from the Pyongyang City Maritime Juvenile Sports School and the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.

articles.title: 46th Meeting of EAFF Executive Committee Held
articles.content:
46th Meeting of EAFF Executive Committee Held
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The 46th meeting of the Executive Committee of the East Asian Football Federation (EAFF) took place here on Saturday.
					 Present there were members of delegation of the EAFF led by Chairman Zhang Jian.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work of the EAFF Executive Committee and the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup and discussed future action program for developing the football in the region.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Anti-Imperialist Class Consciousness
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Anti-Imperialist Class Consciousness
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article says that the anti-imperialist class consciousness should never be allowed to be dulled on the road of the revolution as it is accompanied by sharp confrontation with enemies.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The destiny of socialism depends on the firm anti-imperialist class consciousness.
					
					 It is only our country where the red flag which had fluttered in the period of hewing out the revolution is vigorously fluttering as the banner of socialism even now without losing its color.
					
					 The anti-imperialist class struggle for defending socialism is closely linked with the do-or-die struggle for defending the leader of the revolution.
					
					 Our socialist country is standing as an impregnable fortress as it has service personnel and people who regard defending of the leader with their lives as their life and soul, share idea, intention and breath with the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and sharpen their bayonets to wipe out the enemies.
					
					 A powerful army means that of the revolution and the working class full of hatred against the enemies and love for the socialist system.
					
					 The army for defending socialism can grow strong only thanks to Songun. Songun means independence, dignity and life for our people.
					
					 The true nature of socialism is the advantages of socialism and source of its might which capitalism can neither possess nor imitate.
					
					 The socialist cause of Juche is sure to triumph thanks to the army and people of the DPRK who have firmly maintained the revolutionary stand of defending the leader with their lives, attaching importance to arms and adhering to the principles of socialism with transparent anti-imperialist class consciousness, concludes the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Powell's Invectives against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Powell's Invectives against DPRK
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- It was recently reported that Powell, former U.S. secretary of State under the Bush Administration, blustered at a press conference that the use of nuclear weapons by the DPRK and other countries would be suicide. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday runs a commentary in this regard. 
					
					 We cannot but call into question Powell who in the twilight of his life without any governmental post dared misinterpret the purpose of the DPRK's access to nukes in a bid to public opinion critical of it, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear deterrence was a self-defensive decision to cope with the U.S. reckless nuclear threats to it that has lasted for several decades. 
					
					 The nuclear weapons of the DPRK serve as an almighty treasured sword for protecting the peace on the Korean Peninsula and security of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The DPRK had already served strong warning to the U.S. that if it ignites the second Korean war, it will be a nuclear war and the first target of the DPRK will be strongholds for aggression in the U.S. mainland, all the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces bases in the Pacific military operation theatres and the U.S. military bases in south Korea. 
					
					 The warning clarifies the DPRK's stand on the use of nuclear weapons. 
					
					 What Powell uttered is nothing but bluffing of the weak obsessed with nuclear phobia. 
					
					 The U.S. ruling quarters and military warmongers should not swagger, breathing a sigh of relief after hearing the remarks of Powell.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Hostile Forces of Infringing upon DPRK's Sovereignty
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Hostile Forces of Infringing upon DPRK's Sovereignty
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean authorities are running the whole gamut of invectives against the DPRK over the clarification of its will to launch satellite and conduct a nuclear test, terming it "serious provocation", "military threat" and "wanton violation of UN resolution". The U.S. is mobilizing all types of equipment including spy satellites and desperately egging the south Korean warmongers on to block the DPRK's satellite launch and nuclear test. They are also letting the ministries of Defense, Unification and Foreign Affairs to kick off confrontation rackets against the DPRK.
					 Minju Joson Saturday in a commentary slams this as an unpardonable act of infringing upon the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 As recognized by public at home and abroad, space development has become a world trend. That is why many countries of the world are making huge investment in space development. They are vying with each other to launch satellites to get involved in hot competition for conquering space.
					
					 It is an unpardonable infringement upon the sovereign right of the DPRK for the hostile forces to pull up the DPRK over its satellite launch.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities must know why the DPRK had access to nuclear weapons while tightening its belt despite difficulties and trials. 
					
					 Now that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are becoming all the more pronounced in their moves to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, it is a very just measure for self-defense in every aspect for the DPRK to bolster up the nuclear force both in quality and quantity.
					
					 The U.S. should bear in mind that aggressors and provocateurs' ever more undisguised infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK would only compel it to ratchet up its counter-action against them.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want to join hands with the compatriots in the north and improve the inter-Korean relations, they should properly understand the nature of the situation and act with discretion.

articles.title: 360 Civic and Social Bodies of South Korea Stage Sit-in Strike
articles.content:
360 Civic and Social Bodies of South Korea Stage Sit-in Strike
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- 360 civic and social organizations of south Korea including the Confederation of Trade Unions, Bar Association for Democratic Society and the Solidarity for Progress held a press conference in Seoul on September 17 before launching a sit-in strike against the authorities' anti-workers policy, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea. 
					At the press conference speakers said the authorities agreed on the retrogressive bill on labor market restructuring and through this the "government" openly clarified that it is the regime for the capitalists and declared a war against the people. 
					
					They expressed their will to struggle to the last together with workers and other masses against the "government."

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Protests Authorities' Unjust Education Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Protests Authorities' Unjust Education Policy
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of Education University Students held press conferences at the education universities in nine regions including Pusan and Kwangju on September 15 and clarified a stand to struggle against the present "government's" financial policy for education, according to the south Korean newspaper Hangyore.
					 At the conferences the organization accused the authorities of setting forth in May last a proposal for "making the educational finance efficient" aimed at suppressing the financial right of city and provincial educational offices and pushing forward it.
					
					 It declared that universities under the organization would conduct a campaign for boycotting lessons and stage demonstrations and meetings in Seoul, Sejong, Pusan, Kwangju and Jeju Island in demand of the cancellation of the above-said proposal.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Trying to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through "National Assembly"
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Trying to Railroad "Bill on Human Rights in North" through "National Assembly"
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea in a statement Saturday denounced the south Korean authorities for trying to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly."
					 Such move is a heinous confrontation racket prompted by a sinister political purpose to bring down the workers' world of the DPRK, the spokesman said, and went on:
					
					 There can be no "human rights issue" in the DPRK where everything serves the working people and which gives top priority to the wishes and interests of the people, regards them as absolute and realizes all their dreams and ideal on the highest level.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should set right the human rights issue of south Korea, the veritable hell of the working people, before talking about "human rights" of someone.
					
					 South Korean workers and other people are being driven into suicide, denied even elementary right to existence under the worst working condition, subject to unemployment and poverty, to say nothing of political freedom and right.
					
					 It is nonsense and height of shamelessness for such human rights abusers to talk about "human rights" of someone.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' moves to make the "bill on human rights in the north" a law is a revelation of their base and vicious intention to cover up their unpopular rule and poor human rights performance and suppress and block the mass struggle of the workers to protect their human rights.
					
					 They should stop running riot, clearly understanding the spirit and stamina of the workers of the DPRK who never pardon those who dare slander and hurt the dignity and social system of the DPRK and try to destroy its cradle of creation and happiness.

articles.title: Anniversary of Formation of Union of Korean Students in Japan Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Formation of Union of Korean Students in Japan Marked
Tokyo, September 18 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Japan on Sept. 12 to mark the 70th anniversary of the formation of the Union of Korean Students in Japan.
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of its Central Standing Committee, Kim Hyon Il, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the union, and its successive chairpersons, chairpersons of Chongryon headquarters, leading officials of its organizations and enterprises, members of the union and compatriots.
					
					 Nam Sung U said in a congratulatory speech that the union has led Korean students to contribute to inheritance and development of the Korean community and national reunification.
					
					 The union should further glorify the precious legacies left by the preceding generations and lead young Koreans to live with dignity, not forgetting the identity as Koreans any time and at any place, he stressed.
					
					 The chairman of the union in a report underlined the need to build up the union into an organization playing an important role of Chongryon and the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 A congratulatory message from the DPRK was introduced at the meeting.
					
					 Then followed an art performance.

articles.title: Demo Staged in Russia in Protest against U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Demo Staged in Russia in Protest against U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- There took place a demonstration in Vladivostok, Russia on Sept. 15 in protest against the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 It was staged in front of the U.S. consulate general with the visit to Vladivostok by the U.S. ambassador to Russia as a momentum. It was attended by personages of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation and masses.
					
					 The demonstrators, holding flags of the league and the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, condemned the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and expressed support for the Korean people's just cause.
					
					 Yevgeni Lashenko, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation, said that they staged a demonstration in support of the DPRK and in token of solidarity for the Korean people's cause.

articles.title: Cuban Paper Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Cuban Paper Introduces DPRK
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Cuban paper Granma on Sept. 9 carried an article titled "Wishes for peace and progress" on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK, illustrated with a photo showing the atmosphere on the anniversary.
					 It admits of no argument that since the founding of the DPRK, its independent people have made many achievements in various fields despite the imperialists' ceaseless moves for aggression and difficult circumstances, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 Korea which had groaned under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists, was divided into two parts by big powers after the end of World War II.
					
					 Under the leadership of the great Comrade Kim Il Sung the Korean people started the building of an independent state and emerged genuine masters of the state politics.
					
					 The 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Cuba and the DPRK was marked recently, the paper said, adding: Comrade Kim Jong Un received a state delegation of the Republic of Cuba headed by Miguel Diaz-Canel Bermudez, first vice-president of the Council of State and first vice-president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, during its visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is leading all the people to victory while invariably adhering to its ideology, the paper concluded.

articles.title: Mexican Paper on Suicides in S. Korea
articles.content:
Mexican Paper on Suicides in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Mexican paper Vanguardia on Sept. 14 carried an article titled "South Korea, 'kingdom of suicide'".
					 South Korea always tops the world list of suicide, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 Fierce contest for existence, strong social pressure, indifference to the old, etc. are becoming the basic factor of suicide.
					
					 More than 40 persons on a daily average commit suicide in south Korea.
					
					 At least 14 000 persons commit suicide every year and the number of suicides among the old, in particular, has doubled.
					
					 Suicide is the primary cause of death among young people from teens to thirties.
					
					 One of four students confessed that they determined to kill themselves more than once.
					
					 The basic factor of many suicides is psychological pressure caused by social evils.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation-building Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation-building Praised
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea, posted on its website an article titled "President Kim Il Sung's feats for nation-building" on Sept. 9, 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK's history of development would be unthinkable apart from the exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the nation-building.
					
					 He developed the DPRK into an independent country strictly adhering to the socialist idea and principle.
					
					 He was an elder statesman who led the DPRK government to preserve the socialist principle in all fields of the revolution and construction based on the Juche idea and to steadily implement its revolutionary line.
					
					 He pursued the genuine politics for the people, benevolent politics from the very day he began steering socialist construction.
					
					 He rallied the popular masses as a revolutionary force and advanced the socialist cause, relying on their inexhaustible creative energy.
					
					 He consolidated the military muscle of the DPRK with his Songun leadership.
					
					 His feats for the nation-building were creditably inherited by Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, and are now being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un who is firmly defending socialist Korea from the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their followers.

articles.title: National Day of DPRK Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
National Day of DPRK Celebrated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Pakistan, Bulgaria and Uganda on Sept. 5 and 7 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					Zabed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, said that the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for the development of the country and the cause of global independence will last forever.
					
					Mincho Minchev, chairman of the Bulgarian Communists' Party, Atanas Ivanov, honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, and Lyudmil Kostadinov, chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, referred to Kim Il Sung's feats for the nation-building and the historic significance of the founding of the DPRK.
					
					Kirunda Kivejinja, senior advisor to the president of Uganda, and other speakers praised Kim Il Sung as the peerlessly elder statesman and invincible and iron-willed commander who firmly protected the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					Congratulatory messages to supreme leader Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Pakistan and Bulgaria.

articles.title: FGSC condena intento de autoridades surcoreanas de aprobar "ley de DDHH de Norte"
articles.content:
FGSC condena intento de autoridades surcoreanas de aprobar "ley de DDHH de Norte"
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea (FGSC) hizo publica el dia 19 una declaracion de condena a las tentativas de la "Asamblea Nacional" del Sur de Corea de aprobar la "ley de derechos humanos del Norte (de Corea)".
					Tales maniobras parten del maligno objetivo politico de derrumbar nuestro pais de los obreros, subraya el documento y prosigue:
					
					No puede existir el "problema de DDHH" en la RPDC donde lo todo sirve para las masas populares, se da prioridad absoluta a la demanda y los intereses del pueblo y se realizan todos los suenos e ideales de las masas trabajadoras.
					
					Los politiqueros surcoreanos deben arreglar primero los problemas de DDHH del suelo surcoreano antes de hablar de DDHH de alguien.
					
					Ahora los obreros y otros trabajadores del Sur de Corea, en vez de disfrutar de la libertad y derechos politicos, se ven obligados a optar el suicidio por ser amenazados hasta los derechos elementales a la existencia debido al desempleo, la pobreza y las peores condiciones de trabajo.
					
					Los autores de tal exterminio de DDHH hablan ilogicamente de "DDHH" de alguien.
					
					El intento de fabricar la "ley de DDHH del Norte" de los politiqueros surcoreanos parte de sus entranas viles y astutas de ocultar su politica antipopular y la miserable situacion de DDHH y de reprimir a toda costa la lucha masiva de los trabajadores surcoreanos levantados para defender sus derechos a la subsistencia.
					
					Los politiqueros surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia viendo correctamente el impetu de la clase obrera de la RPDC que no perdona ni en lo minimo a los que difamen e insulten su dignidad y regimen y traten de destruir sus creaciones preciosas y nidos de felicidad.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano a acreditarse en Indonesia
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano a acreditarse en Indonesia
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Segun un decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, An Kwang Il fue nombrado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en la Republica de Indonesia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica disparates de Powell
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica disparates de Powell
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En una reciente entrevista de prensa Powell, quien fue secretario de Estado estadounidense en el periodo de la administracion de Bush, disparateo que el uso de las armas nucleares por parte de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y otros paises sera un acto de suicidio.
					No podemos pasar por alto el hecho de que ese tipejo en los dias de crepusculo de la vida sin ningun cargo oficial del gobierno se atreve a tergiversar y calumniar arbitrariamente el objetivo de la posesion de las armas nucleares de la RPDC y difunde el rumor erroneo.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					La RPDC tomo la decision autofensiva de poseer los artefactos nucleares para hacer frente a la amenaza y chantaje nucleares imprudentes de EE.UU. que se cometen incesantemente de siglo a siglo.
					
					Nuestras armas nucleares es el remedio omnipotente para defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y la seguridad de la nacion coreana.
					
					Ya advertimos fuertemente que la segunda guerra coreana que se provoca por EE.UU. se convertira en la guerra nuclear y ya se fijaron como primer blanco de golpe del Ejercito Popular de Corea las bases agresoras del territorio estadounidense, otras de las tropas norteamericanas en la zona de la operacion militar del Pacifico y en el Sur de Corea. 
					
					Esta advertencia aclara correctamente la posicion de la RPDC en cuanto al uso de las armas nucleares.
					
					Las palabras de Powell no pasan de ser una fanfarronada de la persona debil enfermada de la fobia nuclear.
					
					Las capas dominantes y los belicistas de la capa militar de EE.UU. no deben actuar de manera absurda prestando oidos a las palabras de un viejo chocho.
